reviews.review_msg: Very funny and interesting prof...lectures were always enjoyable
The lectures really had nothing to do with anything at all relevant.

I like her teaching method, she shows you movie clips during lecture that relate to the books. She tells you exactly what vocab and quotes to study, so it was easy to prepare for her final exam. My TA was great too! Great choice of books, good TAs, and  a prof who clearly outlines what's going to be on the exam! I recommend taking her class!
I really enjoyed her ENG 103 lecture and tutorial. My writing capabilities improved vastly thanks to her encouragement and feedback.

Good prof, she tells you what kind of questions are going to be on the final (quotes from lectures, certain stage diagrams, etc) and is clear and straightforward. Involves students in discussions every class. Tutorial attendance counts for 15%, which really helped!
Lectures are all over the place. She's very hard to understand and I found myself completely zoning out the entire lecture most of the time. Avoid her if you can.

One of my favorite profs this year! Classes are fun and interactive. He's enthusiastic and fun to listen to. His slides are online so you can download them for classes and take notes on them. Make sure you listen in class and pay attention during your tutorial.
Fun teacher but no point going to lecture. Key is the tutorials. Good analysis of the works and kept class interesting
Overall he's an okay prof. Tries to make the material interesting. Make sure you read ahead since he jumps from one book to another pretty quickly. I find that his reading list was a bit too much.
I would really recommend this prof! He may be a little crazy at times, but it is very entertaining. Overall, if you have a good TA. you will do well in this course!
an easy course overall, but the prof is not very helpful and knowing the material in the textbook well does not guarantee high marks!!
very very good prof! makes english a fun subject to learn!
dickinson was great! easy to understand guy, which is hard to find in university. a great class thanks to a great proff! =)

He's passionate about the material he is teaching.  He tries to stir up class discussion even though it is a lecture environment. Very good at analyzing the play in relating it to other social issues!!!!
Funny prof. Liberated in expression and is clear in his lectures. It makes us students who took the course appreciate the plays that we study even better.
very good prof...show's a lot of enthusiam

He was fun, he got off topic a lot, but somehow it made sense. the paper questions are hard to answer in the length of one paper, really detailed with multiple part questions. He was a little scatered with lectures, jumping from play to play, but it was fine, i found it a really easy course, if you get the right TA.made the plays complexity simpler

hes a fun prof who likes to keep things interesting. he needs to work on sending out emails or something a bit more regularily for people who might miss classes. I was sick for a week and missed a couple classes and fell way behind but i still kept up with all my other courses by consulting their websites and emails. other than that hes great
pretty cool guy
Very good, funny teacher.  Involves entire class, excellent booklist.
Hillarious, he knows how to keep a class interested
Disorganized. The webct based notes and modules suck. There was little to no learning about anything. Treated students like children.

The worst prof on my lists. Treats students as if they are in high school. Lectures are disorganized, and she just doesn't seem to give the right vibes. She has made my favourite course a complete drag.
Very unclear with what we need to know for our exams :(

HORRIBLE! i really regret taking this course. she's fairly nice but her lectures r just so useless, i had no clue what was going to be on the final exam becuz there were too much pointless discussions during lectures and VERY few notes(lectures seem very unprepared & useless & boring) - overall, very disappointed
You will ace this course if you write persuasive and argumentative essays. Just be in touch with your thoughts and ideas. or just bs!
Most teachers aren't even worth looking up but Mr. Budra is pretty top quality. Wish my other English professors were as helpful as him. Sigh. Just two more years to go...

Budra is sensational, awesome dude! He is very engaging and gives clear cut notes. He does not try to surprise you and is very relevant to how he approaches his classes. No phonelaptops allowed in class, but overall its really good! Watch out for your TA's tho, they mark everything for you... you have been warned!
Made the lectures extremely relevant to material and very straight-forward. Liked his passion and enthusiasm in class but no phone rules !
he was great...one of my best profs at uni....great insights...one of the classes i looked forward to going to
INteresting guy, was lucky enough to have him for tutorial too!
this was his second class I took (and I hate english) just b/c he's that good!
so damn sexy I didn't miss a class!
No Comments

I absolutely LOVED Diana. She's easily one of my favourite professors at SFU. Her interest and enthusiasm is infectious, and she's always willing to help you. If you have the chance to have her as a professor, go for it! I was fortunate enough to have her as my tutorial leader.   She has a cute corgi too.
